byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan forces resignation of Prime Min Ahmet Davutoglu; increasingly autocratic leader's purge of his closest political ally is latest move in his campaign to consolidate power; experts suggest Erdogan was angered and threatened by Davutoglu's increasingly high international profile.
lead_paragraph: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey has purged the judiciary of enemies, jailed journalists and crushed protests. Now, he has ousted his closest political ally, Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu.

headline.main: How Erdogan Moved to Solidify Power by Ousting a Pivotal Ally
headline.print_headline: How Erdogan Ousted Turkish Premier in Drive for Power

snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey has purged the judiciary of enemies, jailed journalists and crushed protests. Now, he has ousted his closest political ally, Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
